actions

Class ActionQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • actions.ActionQueue

  • public class ActionQueue
extends Object
    All things related to storing and going through sequences of actions. ActionQueue itself acts like a Queue of actions, while actions act like queues of keypresses (commands). When calling pollCommand(), this will return the next set of keypresses from the current action, while automatically advancing through actions when one's duration is complete.
    Author:
    Matt
    See Also:
    Queue, Action, ActionSet

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionQueue

        public ActionQueue()

    • Method Detail

      • peekThisAction

        public Action peekThisAction()
        See the action we are currently executing. Does not change the queue.
        Returns:
        Action which is currently being executed (i.e. timings and keypresses).

      • peekNextAction

        public Action peekNextAction()
        See the next action we will execute. Does not change the queue.
        Returns:
        Next full action that will run (i.e. timings and keys). Returns null if no future actions remain.

      • peekCommand

        public boolean[] peekCommand()
        See the next keypresses.
        Returns:
        Next QWOP keypresses as a boolean array. True is pressed, false is not pressed.

      • addAction

        public void addAction(Action action)
        Adds a new action to the end of the queue. If this is the first action to be added, it is loaded up as the current action. All added actions are copied internally.
        Parameters:
        action - Action to add to the end of the queue as a copy. Does not influence current polling of the queue elements.

      • addSequence

        public void addSequence(Action[] actions)
        Add a sequence of actions. All added actions are copied.
        Parameters:
        actions - Array of actions to add to the end of the queue. They are copied, and adding does not influence polling of the existing queue.

      • pollCommand

        public boolean[] pollCommand()
        Request the next QWOP keypress commands from the added sequence. Automatically advances between actions.
        Returns:
        Get the next command (QWOP true/false array) on the queue.

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Remove everything from the queues and reset the sequence.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if the queue has anything in it.
        Returns:
        Whether this queue has more commands left to poll.

      • getActionsInCurrentRun

        public Action[] getActionsInCurrentRun()
        Get all the actions in this queue.
        Returns:
        All actions in this queue, including ones which have already been executed.

      • getCurrentActionIdx

        public int getCurrentActionIdx()
        Index of the current action. 0 is the first Action.
        Returns:
        Index of the current action.
